scheme_data.schemeName: Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department-Hostels: Special Guides
scheme_data.shortDescription: {"id": "3DJfGJIBISXYddfJNJlU", "fields": {"beneficiaryState": ["Tamil Nadu"], "schemeShortTitle": "ADTHSG", "level": "State", "nodalMinistryName": null, "schemeCategory": ["Education & Learning", "Housing & Shelter"], "schemeName": "Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department-Hostels: Special Guides", "schemeCloseDate": null, "slug": "adthsg", "briefDescription": "The scheme provides hostel facilities to all boys and girls boarders studying up to XII Standard.\n", "age": {"ews": {"gte": 18, "lte": 100}, "sc": {"gte": 18, "lte": 100}, "general": {"gte": 18, "lte": 100}, "obc": {"gte": 18, "lte": 100}, "st": {"gte": 18, "lte": 100}, "female": {"gte": 18, "lte": 100}, "widowed": {"gte": 18, "lte": 100}}, "tags": ["Tribal Welfare", "Adi Dravidar", "Students", "Hostels", "Education", "Accommodation"]}, "highlight": {}}
scheme_data.description:
The name of this welfare scheme is Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department-Hostels: Special Guides. It is also known as ADTHSG. The scheme “Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department-Hostels: Special Guides” by the Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department, Tamil Nadu, aims to offer hostel accommodations to students belonging to the Adi Dravidar and Tribal communities. The initiative supports their education by ensuring a safe and structured environment for studying, addressing the housing needs of students from underprivileged backgrounds. The facilities are available for students up to the XII Standard. The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual. It is specifically implemented in Tamil Nadu. Additionally, the nodal department is Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department.

The scheme provides the following benefits: Accommodation: Hostel facility for all Boys/ Girls Boarders studying upto XII Standard.

Eligibility criteria include: The beneficiary should be a Student.
  The beneficiary should be a resident of Tamil Nadu.
  The beneficiary should belong to the Adi Dravidar/ Tribal community.
  The beneficiary should be enrolled within XII Standard (Stn. XII or lower). The application process is as follows: Students/ Guardians should contact the warden or matron of the hostel with all the required documents as directed by the authority. For more information, please refer to: Guidelines: https://www.tn.gov.in/scheme/data_view/83078 Tags associated with the scheme include: Accommodation, Adi Dravidar, Education, Hostels, Students, Tribal Welfare.

sentences.sent: The name of this welfare scheme is Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department-Hostels: Special Guides.
It is also known as ADTHSG.

The scheme “Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department-Hostels: Special Guides” by the Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department, Tamil Nadu, aims to offer hostel accommodations to students belonging to the Adi Dravidar and Tribal communities.
The initiative supports their education by ensuring a safe and structured environment for studying, addressing the housing needs of students from underprivileged backgrounds.
The facilities are available for students up to the XII Standard.
The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual.
It is specifically implemented in Tamil Nadu.
Additionally, the nodal department is Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department.
The scheme provides the following benefits: Accommodation: Hostel facility for all Boys/ Girls Boarders studying upto XII Standard.
Eligibility criteria include: The beneficiary should be a Student.
The beneficiary should be a resident of Tamil Nadu.
The beneficiary should belong to the Adi Dravidar/ Tribal community.
The beneficiary should be enrolled within XII Standard (Stn.
XII or lower).
The application process is as follows: Students/ Guardians should contact the warden or matron of the hostel with all the required documents as directed by the authority.
For more information, please refer to: Guidelines: https://www.
tn.
gov.
in/scheme/data_view/83078 Tags associated with the scheme include: Accommodation, Adi Dravidar, Education, Hostels, Students, Tribal Welfare.

", "answer": "Additional information can be acquired by contacting the Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department or the warden/matron of the hostel.

ctus.text: The name of this welfare scheme is Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department-Hostels: Special Guides. It is also known as ADTHSG. The scheme “Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department-Hostels: Special Guides” by the Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department, Tamil Nadu, aims to offer hostel accommodations to students belonging to the Adi Dravidar and Tribal communities. The initiative supports their education by ensuring a safe and structured environment for studying, addressing the housing needs of students from underprivileged backgrounds.

The facilities are available for students up to the XII Standard. The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual. It is specifically implemented in Tamil Nadu. Additionally, the nodal department is Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department.

The scheme provides the following benefits: Accommodation: Hostel facility for all Boys/ Girls Boarders studying upto XII Standard. Eligibility criteria include: The beneficiary should be a Student. The beneficiary should be a resident of Tamil Nadu. The beneficiary should belong to the Adi Dravidar/ Tribal community.

The beneficiary should be enrolled within XII Standard (Stn. XII or lower). The application process is as follows: Students/ Guardians should contact the warden or matron of the hostel with all the required documents as directed by the authority. For more information, please refer to: Guidelines: https://www.
